article.description: Keon Johnson pumped in 10 3-pointers and posted a season-high 36 points to help power hot-shooting Winthrop to a 97-72 romp past Charleston Southern in a Big South battle Wednesday night.
article.headline: Johnson leads Winthrop past Charleston Southern 97-72
article.linkText: Johnson leads Winthrop past Charleston Southern 97-72
article.story: ROCK HILL, S.C. -- Keon Johnson pumped in 10 3-pointers and posted a season-high 36 points to help power hot-shooting Winthrop to a 97-72 romp past Charleston Southern in a Big South battle Wednesday night. The junior was 11-of-16 shooting from the field, hitting 10 of 13 from beyond the arc. Charleston Southern took 10 more long-range shots than Johnson and drained just six. The Eagles built a 40-31 lead by halftime and pulled away in the second half. Winthrop was 30 of 60 from the field (50 percent) as a team knocked down 17 of 28 from beyond the arc and 20 of 25 from the free-throw line. Xavier Cooks and Jimmy Gavin each added 13 points for Winthrop (15-6, 7-3 Big South). Aaron Wheeler scored 22 points and grabbed 12 rebounds to lead the Buccaneers (8-13, 4-6). Demetrius Pollard and Patrick Wallace each added 11 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
